image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Texas; born in Bay City, Matagorda County, Tex., January 21, 1942; graduated from West Columbia High School, 1960; B.A., Texas A.&M. University, 1964; LL.B., University of Texas School of Law, 1967; United States Army, 1968-1970; United States Army Reserve, 1964-1967, 1970-1988; admitted to the bar in 1967; lawyer, private practice; assistant district attorney, Harris County, Tex., 1970-1974; unsuccessful candidate for election to the One Hundredth Congress in 1986; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred First and to the three succeeding Congresses, changed party affiliation from a Democrat to a Republican on June 26, 1995, continued serving as a Republican in the One Hundred Fourth Congress (January 3, 1989-January 3, 1997); was an unsuccessful candidate for renomination to the One Hundred Fifth Congress in 1996.

researchRecord.name: 1986-1990, 20 commercials on 6 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Greg Laughlin's campaigns for the 1986, 1988, and 1990 U.S. congressional elections in District 14 of Texas, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication
